intro: Erythrochiton fallax, commonly known as the red-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking red to purple leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are often glossy and have a velvety texture, while the flowers bloom in clusters. Erythrochiton fallax is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
